The name is derived from the Arabic root word âhamida,â meaning âto praise.â The name could also carry meanings like âmost commendableâ or âmost praiseworthy.â Ahmad can also be spelled as Ahmed or Ahmet. In Islamic tradition, Allah is referred to as al-Hamid, one of the 99 names of Allah. The name Ahmad, being of Arabic origin, is said to have its roots in a Quranic prophecy that was attributed to Jesus in the Quran 61:6. Islamic scholars generally agree that this prophecy was referring to the Prophet Muhammad. In some Islamic traditions, the name Ahmad is considered to be another given name of Muhammad, which was given to him at birth by his mother. Muslims believe that Ahmad is a more esoteric name for Muhammad and is reflect his true nature. Ahmad can also be a last name and means âthe most praisedâ and is an adjective derived from Hamid. This term is used as an honorific title for the Prophet Muhammad. Other surnames that have a similar meaning to Ahmad are Abad, Ahmadi, Samad, Aman, Hamad, Aswad, Shad, Rahman, Hammad, and Asmar. The name Ahmad is one of the most commonly used transliterations of the Arabic name, particularly in the Middle East and across the Muslim world. Another variant transliteration of the name is Ahmed, which is more commonly used in the context of the Ottoman Empire. This transliteration is also popular throughout the world. Apart from Ahmed (Urdu, Dhivehi, and Pashto),the common variations of the name Ahmad in different languages and cultures include Ahmadu(Hausa), Hamit(Albanian), Akmad(Tausug), Akhmad(Chechen), Aamadu(Fula), Akhmad(Ingush), Akmad(Maguindanao), Axmed(Somali), Hamit, Ahmet (Turkish), Hamid, Hameed(Arabic), Ehmet(Uyghur), Ehmed(Kurdish), Amadou, Amadu(Western African), and Akhmad(Indonesian). According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sunâs position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
